name: Acupuncture Healing Energy Bootcamp - Wellness Workshop
description:
Join us for an eye-opening and heart-opening session of healing at Atta Galatta on Saturday, 18th January, 11 AM to 12:30 PM
In this session you will:
Learn about the ancient Chinese system of healing known as Acupuncture
Understand how blocked and imbalanced energies in our bodies could lead to chronic physical and emotional ailments
Get personalized treatment to unblock and balance your energies (no needles involved)
Have an intense guided journalling and meditation session to uncover inner wounds and heal them
Get tips for a more balanced life
Ideal for those who suffer from recurring physical ailments, those who seek to break recurring unhealthy behavioural patterns, those seeking relief from stress and anxiety and for curious souls looking to understand their bodies and minds better.
Participants are requested to wear loose and comfortable clothing as we will be doing some light stretches during the session.
Please bring along a pen and a bottle of water.

name: Food In Indian Literature - Book Club
description:
Our emotions and memories are intrinsically related to the food we eat and the genre of food literature combines them in a way that helps us connect not only to our past and our present, to different cultures, and communities, values and rituals, events both life-changing and mundane but to each other as well.
So, if viewing the world through the lens of food and literature interests you, then join us to begin a dialogue on “Food in Indian Literature” and to celebrate those stories and their diversity. Each month with Prachi Grover, we will be reading our way through several powerful (and delicious) narratives.
January Read: Sweet Malida: Memories of a Bene Israel Woman by Zilka Joseph
We assure you that you will enjoy every single bite!
The session is free but registration is a must as we have limited spots available.
Prachi Grover is a culinary consultant and educator and is the founder of “From Words to Wok”; a community for people who to love to read and eat!

name: The Only Way Out is Death - Book Signing
description:
"... Saw meets Squid Game meets Agatha Christie. Such a gripping read!!" - Satyasha, Influencer
"Taut, complex and full of surprises, this page turner will keep you locked in till the very end." - Richa S Mukherjee, Author of An Unfinished Melody and Kanpur Khoofiya pvt. ltd.
Loved watching the Korean survival drama Squid Game? Eagerly awaiting Season 2? Read Varun Gwalani's latest murder mystery to tide you over until the new season!
From author Varun Gwalani comes a new escape room murder mystery. The Only Way Out is Death is a fast-paced suspense novel set in an empty hotel, where twelve people have to kill to survive.
Join us for the book signing at Atta Galatta on 18th January at 12 PM!

name: 1000 Days of Love - Weekly Book Reading Sessions
description:
What is it? TDOL Secret Sessions is a one-of-a-kind event series to give you a front-row seat to the upcoming novel, 1000 Days of Love. In each session, the author will read two chapters and get your feedback in real time, while you get to meet like-minded people and build lifelong connections. 
Who is doing it? This event is hosted by the novel's author, Soundarya Balasubramani. She's a 2x author, founder of an American startup, renowned speaker, and influencer. Find her on LinkedIn and Instagram.
Why? Products have "launches" where they get user feedback to iterate and improve. Why not a book too? 
When? Ten sessions are hosted beginning January 11th, 2025 - February 9th, 2025, every Saturday and Sunday afternoon.
Where?  Atta Galatta- The Bookstore (178, 5th Main Rd, Indira Nagar 1st Stage, 1st Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038)
We're only choosing 25 people per session. Spots are limited. Please apply below and we'll be in touch :) Let's create some magic together ✨
***DETAILS***
📅 Sessions: Every Saturday and Sunday at 2 PM IST, starting January 11, 2025
🕒 Duration: 90 minutes
📍 Location: Atta Galatta - The Bookstore, Bangalore, India
🎟️ Cost: Free of cost + Free food and refreshments + Incentives (Receive a free copy of the book when you attend 2 or more sessions, and earn an exclusive TDOL T-shirt 👕 by joining 5 or more sessions! 😊✨)

name: Mehfil 3.0 – Celebrating Women in Poetry - Poetry Circle
description:
Join us for the third edition of MEHFIL, presented by Aavirbhaav Kaavya Manch, as we come together to honor the timeless beauty of poetry.
This special gathering is dedicated to celebrating Women in Poetry, featuring soul-stirring recitations and thought-provoking discussions about their profound impact on the world of verse.
We invite you to bring your own original poems to life, offering a platform for both budding and seasoned poets to showcase their talent and creativity.
Immerse yourself in an afternoon of poetic brilliance, meaningful conversations, and a shared love for the written word. Let your voice find its place at Aavirbhaav Kaavya Manch, where words connect hearts and minds.
Note: Poetries from languages other than Hindi/Urdu are also welcome

name: Aviraam - Film Screening
description:
A short film screening & a fundraiser prelude to Swaraanubhuti- a musical concert for Palliative Care in support of families affected by chronic diseases as ably championed by the Swami Vivekananda Youth Movement.
Aviraam/अविराम, meaning in continuum or without pause, is a short film about discovering a sense of belonging between two strangers. The individual and different life journeys of both characters find crossroads in hope and acceptance, in this 'Coming of age' themed story.
The film came alive as a Residency project curated at the Forge by LevelUp Learning, the world's first creative residency bootcamp for filmmakers. The project is also a tribute to every stranger the filmmaker has met in her own life as they smiled back, patted her back, exchanged a poem or a note, offered a hug, shared stories, and, were kind in the brief time spent together. Each, in their own heartwarming way, have been an inspiration in action. And this film, therefore, is a 'Gratitude Note'.
The film especially acknowledges and celebrates the Indigo Airlines and their conscious, generous efforts towards Diversity, Equity and Inclusion. A personal heartwarming incident with one of the Indigo Ground Crew at the Chennai Airport has inspired the character arc of one of the protagonists of the film.
Story, Script & Direction: Asambhava Shubha
Assistant Direction: Gautham Krishna
Cast: Ajith Prasad, Gautham Krishna, Asambhava Shubha
Music: Saurabh Tripathi
DOP: Mahesh MSP
Editing: Mahesh MSP & Dhanvignesh Aamuri
Sound Design & Mix: Dhanvignesh Aamuri
Curated at: The Forge by LevelUp Learning
Location: Jaipur(Rajasthan), India

name: Let's Get Waste-ed! - A Day-Long Festival Spotlighting Sustainable Living
description:
Welcome to Atta Galatta’s Let’s Get Waste-ed initiative that aims to spotlight sustainable living, waste management, and all sorts of upcycling initiatives! Join us for a day of mindful consumption, with textile collection drives, thrift stores, handmade products by local artists, panel discussions and screenings. Best part? There’s a massive sale on adults and children’s books too! Give these discounted, second-hand books a home and keep the cycle of reusing going!
If you’re a novice in the world of sustainable living, we have an Introduction to Zero Waste Living workshop that is sure to help you kickstart your journey. If you’re looking to upgrade your existing setup, join us for a workshop on composting. There’s something for everyone!
We can’t wait to see you at Atta Galatta, participating in the magic that turns trash into treasure.

name: Textile Collection Drive - Collection Drive
description: Join us at Atta Galatta on 19th January for a textile collection drive, facilitated by Saamuhika Shakti. We will have a collection area throughout the day on 19th January, starting from 11 AM and until 7 PM, where you can come drop off your old clothes and other items made of cloth.

name: Chapters Unsealed 7.0 - Book Club
description:
Atta Galatta and Your View on Books cordially invite you to the latest Bibliophile Meetup in town.
Join us for an enriching evening of literary discussion and camaraderie at our Book Club Meet event! Whether you`re a seasoned bibliophile or just discovering the joy of reading, all are welcome to share their insights, opinions, and favorite passages. Engage in lively conversations, exchange recommendations, and bond over our mutual love for literature. Don`t miss out on this opportunity to connect with fellow book enthusiasts and expand your literary horizons!
What does it entail:
Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
Sharing your views on favorite books.
Participating in the curated discussion.
Voting for a Monthly Book Read.
Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
Listen more. Speak mindfully.
No monopolising the conversation.

name: Divine Delicacies - Storytelling and Menu Tasting Session
description: Food is such an integral part of our lives that we cannot imagine any worship without food. Keeping this in mind, we welcome you to a unique experience where we shall serve you samples of prasadams from various temples and share stories of places of worship and the perceived food preferences of the divine. Join Aparna Jaishankar for Divine Delicacies, only at Atta Galatta.

name: Read A Kitaab - Monthly Book Club
description:
New Year, New Reads, New Goals!
Let’s kickstart 2025 with a Read A Kitaab New Year Meet-Up!
Bring your favorite reads, share your literary resolutions, and dive into inspiring conversations with fellow book lovers. 📚✨
🗓️ When: 19 January, 2025
📍 Where: Atta Galatta, Indira Nagar
⏰ Time: 4:00pm - 6:00pm
🎭 Theme: Books & Goals for 2025
💫 Whether you’re planning to conquer your TBR, explore new genres, or finally write that book—you’ll find your tribe here!
🎟️ Entry Free | Registration Mandatory
Let’s turn the page on 2024 and write an unforgettable 2025—one book at a time!

name: Object Detectives! - Archeology Workshop for Children
description:
Object Detectives!
In this interactive session, Devika will engage young people in reading clues from ancient remains to reveal stories of the long-ago people who made them. Participants will then write their own ‘object stories’, discovering a whole new way of understanding the past!
Award-winning author Devika Cariapa trained as an archaeologist before she found her calling in making the world of archaeology accessible for children.
Her works of historical non-fiction have won the Sahitya Akademi’s Bal Sahitya Puraskar 2019, The Hindu Young World-Goodbooks Award, the Neev Award and the Times of India AutHer Award. Her latest book, A Children’s History of India in 100 Objects explores our rich material culture through objects ranging from prehistoric to contemporary times.

name: An Evening of Magic - Magic Show
description: An Evening of Magic is a most amazing magic show presented by `Nakul Shenoy & Friends`, featuring top entertainers and magic acts. Curated and hosted by the internationally-acclaimed mentalist Nakul Shenoy, each event in this series brings unique acts and performances by nationally and internationally acclaimed magicians, alongside some of the most notable up-and-coming stars of magic. This is an evening that is truly magical, and one you will want to experience many times over.

name: Cut Nib Calligraphy - Calligraphy Workshop
description:
25th & 26th January 2025 - 2-Day Workshop - 6 Hours of Training - 2 Scripts
Cut Nib Calligraphy traces its roots back centuries, to ancient civilizations such as the Greeks, Romans, and Chinese, who used vivid chisel-tipped writing instruments to inscribe their languages and artistic expressions onto various surfaces.
Fast forward to the modern era, Cut Nib Calligraphy continues to thrive as both a traditional craft and a contemporary art form. Today, artists and enthusiasts worldwide explore its expressive potential, blending traditional techniques with modern innovations to create stunning works of calligraphy art in this 2-day workshop!
What you will learn from this workshop:
-Origin of Calligraphy
-The meaning behind this art
-Introduction to Tools
-Understanding Stroke Variations
-Exploring & Learning Two Letter Forms: Roman & Gothic
-Promoting Continued Practise post workshop
Whether you`re a seasoned calligrapher or a curious beginner, this workshop offers an opportunity to refine your skills and discover more about Calligraphy
What do you need to bring?
Water bottle to keep you hydrated
This workshop includes all materials if required kindly get an Examination Pad / Paper Board

name: Unscramble JANUARY - January Storytelling Meetup for Adults
description:
The new year is here and as we fill our minds with hopes and dreams for a wonderful year ahead, BSS wishes you all a very happy new year!
We wanted to start off this year with a playful teaser theme! And here it is… All you have to do is Unscramble the letters of JANUARY, create as many new words from the jumbled letters, and bring a story based on any one word. 
We loved doing this exercise and we are sure you will love it too! 
Once you have a story and you wish to tell, write to us your storyline, and the word that triggered that story.
We are already excited to see the different genre that you all are going to bring this month. 🙂🙂🙂
Remember, there is no storyteller without an audience. So if you feel like joining us as a listener, you are most welcome! 
The meet up is FREE so don't forget to get your friends too. The more the merrier. 🥳 🎉 
Send us the synopsis of your storyline to
bangalorestorytellingsociety@gmail.com by 21st January.
About BSS 
BSS is a not-for-profit organization established in the year 2013 by like-minded story lovers with the sole idea of reviving and promoting the oral storytelling traditions in India. The monthly meet-up for adults by the BANGALORE STORYTELLING SOCIETY, that began in 2013, aims to revive the traditional way of sharing tales amidst a gathering.  This is one of the longest running meetups in India.
Any questions? We are glad to help. WhatsApp: 9845680816

name: BWW Short Story Community - Literary Meetup
description:
The BWW Short Story Community
This month we will discuss The Woman Who Lost Her Head by Madhavi Mahadevan from Hell Hath No Fury (ed. Shinie Antony). 
What this is:
This is a ticketed, curated literary and community event, presented by Bhumika Anand from the Bangalore Writers Workshop, where we will do a deep-dive analysis and discussion of a short story.
You get to join a reading community where you will get to read a pre-chosen short story a month.
You get to examine the story in terms of its literary merit, yes, but also in terms of writing craft and context, which will be very useful if you are an aspiring storyteller or writer.
Who should join:
If you are above 18 years old, interested in storytelling, literature, or are an aspiring or published author, this is for you.
If you are new in the city and want to be part of a community and make friends over writing,storytelling, and literature, then this is for you.
What does it entail:
Reading the prescribed story.
Participating in the curated discussion.
Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
Listen more. Speak mindfully.
No monopolising the conversation.

name: Mindful Moves - Movement Workshop
description:
Mindful Moves is a unique practice founded by Sreya Ridhiban, offering dance movement therapy that focuses on mind-body connection and trauma healing. It provides a safe space to unwind, learn, unlearn, and destress. Each session incorporates sound healing, card pulling, and somatic practices, delivering a holistic approach to mental and physical well-being.
In today’s world, prioritizing mental health is as important as physical health. Movement plays a significant role in releasing trauma stored in the body, and Mindful Moves embraces this philosophy. You don’t have to be a dancer to move—this space is for everyone.

name: Find Your Voice - Theatre Performance
description:
The "Find Your Voice" workshop is a four-hour intensive designed to help stage artists and aspiring performers discover, refine, and enhance their vocal abilities. Voice is one of the most critical tools for a performer, and this workshop delves into the essential elements of posture, breathing, sound production, and projection to equip participants with techniques for delivering powerful and sustainable performances.
Key Sections of the Workshop
1. Foundations of Voice and Posture
Posture and Alignment
Warm-Up and Body Awareness
2. Breathing Techniques for Vocal Power
Understanding Breath Control
Practical Breathing Exercises
Breath and Movement Coordination
3. Unlocking Vocal Potential
Expanding Vocal Range
Articulation and Resonance
Vocal Health
4. Voice Projection and Emotional Expression
Projection Techniques
Expressing Emotion Through Voice

name: A Story Walk Through Indiranagar - Story Walk
description: On a Sunday morning, walk through the lanes of INDIRA NAGAR with Vikram Sridhar discovering the lanes through the Folklore, Heritage and Ecology of the area. The walk will begin and culminate at ATTA GALATTA. The tales will revolve around historical, mythical and personal narratives weaved as we discover the area through the walk.
